unnormalised: ## Going Viral, Bollywood Style: Decoding the Latest Social Media Trends
normalised: ## Going Viral, Bollywood Style: Decoding the Latest Social Media Trends

unnormalised: Hey guys! So, you know how everyone’s chasing that viral moment, hoping to become the next Bhuvan Bam or Prajakta Koli? Let's talk about what's making waves right now in the crazy world of Indian social media.
normalised: Hey guys! So, you know how everyone’s chasing that viral moment, hoping to become the next Bhuvan Bam or Prajakta Koli? Let's talk about what's making waves right now in the crazy world of Indian social media.

unnormalised: Forget perfectly curated feeds; authenticity is king (and queen!). Remember the whole “Rasode Mein Kaun Tha” trend? It was simple, relatable, and BOOM, everywhere. People were creating parodies, remixes…even Smriti Irani joined in! That’s the power of a genuine, funny moment.

unnormalised: Right now, dance challenges are still HUGE. Especially those featuring Bollywood remixes. Think “Lut Gaye” or “Bijlee Bijlee.” Slap on a filter, rope in your friends from college (or even your chachi!), and get grooving. You never know, your impromptu dance at the Gateway of India might be your ticket to internet fame.

unnormalised: But it’s not just about dances. Short-form video is the undisputed ruler. Reels, TikToks…they're all competing for your attention. The key? Hooking viewers within the first few seconds. Think catchy audio, visually stunning content, or a seriously relatable meme.

unnormalised: What else is trending? Well, anything DIY related! From recreating Mom's secret biryani recipe (thanks, Amma!) to fixing that leaky tap, people are loving practical content. Think "Jugaad" meets YouTube tutorial.

unnormalised: One thing’s for sure: trends are fleeting. What’s hot today might be old news by 23/01/2024, 14:00 hrs. So, stay agile, keep experimenting, and most importantly, have fun!

unnormalised: Don’t forget the power of influencer collaborations. Partnering with a smaller, niche influencer can often be more effective than throwing money at a mega-influencer. They often have a more engaged audience and can authentically promote your product or service. Think collaborating with a travel blogger for your new Goa resort (launching on 15/08/2023!).

unnormalised: And lastly, remember to keep an eye on the festive calendar. Diwali, Holi, Eid… these are prime opportunities to create culturally relevant and engaging content. Just make sure you're being respectful and authentic. No one wants to see another generic “Happy Diwali” post at 09:00 hrs, 12/11/2023.
